alert.note: Alert for Wayne (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 28 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Lawrence and central Wayne Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 459 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Yatesville Lake State Park, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Louisa, Wayne, Blaine, Yatesville Lake State Park, Fort Gay, Ulysses, East Lynn Lake, Charley, Centerville, Kiahsville, Dunlow, Gallup, Clifford, Glenhayes, Buchanan, Houckville, Fallsburg, East Lynn and Genoa. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
